title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement [INSERT CONTACT METHOD]. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/ code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Introduction to {a11ytables}
text: vignette shows use {a11ytables} generate spreadsheet output.

title: Introduction to {a11ytables}
text: installed {a11ytables} package, three steps generating spreadsheet: Use new_a11ytable() create special dataframe object contains information need output Use create_a11y_wb() add styles workbook structure Use openxlsx::saveWorkbook() write xlsx file minimal demo follows steps, using example data built-mtcars dataset. can use RStudio Addin, installed package, insert pre-filled demo skeleton workflow.

title: Introduction to {a11ytables}
text: argument new_a11ytable() provides information required sheet spreadsheet. provide majority information dataframes passed tables argument. ’s preferable prepare first passing new_a11ytable(). demo tables can pass new_a11ytable(). ’ve used tibble::tribble() human-readable row--row dataframe construction, can just use data.frame(). Now can construct a11ytable passing required sheet ‘elements’ vectors (list case tables) new_a11ytable() function. function return errors warnings anything missing seems odd. example, ’re warned empty cells Table 1, though example ’ve provided meaning cover sheet. ’s preview object created: can immediately tell a11ytable ’s first word ’s printed output. a11ytable basically just table one row per sheet one column per sheet element. fact, class ‘data.frame’/‘tbl’ along ‘a11ytable’: convenience, can also check a11ytable class is_a11ytable(). Note new_a11ytable() preferred method, ’s also possible convert correctly-formatted pre-built data.frame directly a11ytable as_a11ytable(). can try using mtcars_df data.frame ’s provided {a11ytables}.
code: library(tibble)  # Create demo tables of info for supporting sheets  cover_df <-  # required, will be transposed in the final output    tribble(      ~"Sub title",  ~"Sub body",     "Description", "Aspects of automobile design and performance.",     "Properties",  paste0(                      "Suppressed values are replaced with the value '[c]'.",                      "\n\n",  # line break into paragraphs                      "Blank cells in the 'Notes' column indicate the absence of a note."                    ),     "Contact",     "The mtcars Team, telephone 0123456789."   )  contents_df <-  # required   tribble(     ~"Sheet name", ~"Sheet title",     "Notes",       "Notes used in the statistical tables of this workbook",     "Table 1",     "Car Road Tests (demo)"   )  notes_df <-  # not required if there's no notes in your tables   tribble(     ~"Note number", ~"Note text",     "[note 1]",     "US gallons.",  # notes should be in the form '[note 1]'     "[note 2]",     "Retained to enable comparisons with previous analyses."   )  # Create simple demo stats table  stats_df <- mtcars |>   head() |>   rownames_to_column("car") |>   subset(select = c("car", "cyl", "mpg"))  names(stats_df) <- c(   "Car",   "Cylinder count",   "Miles per gallon [note 1]"  # notes should go in headers, not cells )  stats_df$Notes <- c(  # add a 'Notes' column to supply row-wise notes   rep("[note 2]", 2),    rep(NA_character_, 4) )  stats_df[3, 2:3] <- "[c]"  # example of suppressed (confidential) data library(a11ytables) library(openxlsx)  # was installed with {a11ytables}  my_a11ytable <- new_a11ytable(   tab_titles = c(     "Cover",     "Contents",     "Notes",     "Table 1"   ),   sheet_types = c(  # 'cover', 'contents', 'notes' or 'tables' only     "cover",     "contents",     "notes",     "tables"  # stats tables, appendices, etc   ),   sheet_titles = c(  # will appear in cell A1 of each sheet     "The 'mtcars' Demo Datset",     "Table of contents",     "Notes",     "Car Road Tests"   ),   sources = c(     NA_character_,  # use NA where source isn't needed     NA_character_,     NA_character_,      "Motor Trend (1974)"  # will be inserted above the table   ),   table_names = c(  # make these unique, used by screenreaders     "cover_sheet",     "table_of_contents",     "notes_table",     "cars_table"   ),   tables = list(  # as prepared earlier, note it's a list     cover_df,     contents_df,     notes_df,     stats_df   ) ) # Warning: You have blank cells in these tables: Table 1. my_a11ytable # # a11ytables: 4 x 6 #   tab_title sheet_type sheet_title              source       table_name table    #   <chr>     <chr>      <chr>                    <chr>        <chr>      <list>   # 1 Cover     cover      The 'mtcars' Demo Datset NA           cover_she… <tibble> # 2 Contents  contents   Table of contents        NA           table_of_… <tibble> # 3 Notes     notes      Notes                    NA           notes_tab… <tibble> # 4 Table 1   tables     Car Road Tests           Motor Trend… cars_table <df> class(my_a11ytable) # [1] "a11ytable"  "tbl"        "data.frame"

title: Introduction to {a11ytables}
text: can use create_a11y_wb() convert a11ytable {openxlsx} Workbook-class object. function inserts sheets information a11ytable applies various mark-styles meet best practice guidance. ’s preview summary Workbook object: output limited, can see overview named sheets custom styling.
code: my_wb <- create_a11y_wb(my_a11ytable) my_wb # A Workbook object. #   # Worksheets: #  Sheet 1: "Cover" #   #   Custom row heights (row: height) #    2: 34, 4: 34, 6: 34  #   Custom column widths (column: width) #     1: 80  #   #  #  Sheet 2: "Contents" #   #   Custom column widths (column: width) #     1: 30, 2: 30  #   #  #  Sheet 3: "Notes" #   #   Custom column widths (column: width) #     1: 15, 2: 80  #   #  #  Sheet 4: "Table 1" #   #   Custom column widths (column: width) #     1: 16, 2: 16, 3: 16, 4: 16  #   #  #   #  Worksheet write order: 1, 2, 3, 4 #  Active Sheet 1: "Cover"  #   Position: 1

title: Introduction to {a11ytables}
text: Finally, can use saveWorkbook() function {openxlsx} save workbook object xlsx file. also open temporary copy workbook openXL(), convenient development process. content output spreadsheet look like :  ’ll notice formatting (e.g. Arial size 12 font body text) mark-(e.g. tables, donated marker lower-right corner lower-right cell one) applied throughout. can apply final tweaks file defaults don’t quite meet needs, though ’s advisable keep minimum. time writing (v0.0.0.90014) need address two accessibility requirements yet covered package: apply H1 headers sheet titles (may need reformat Arial 16 bold) manually complete document properties (likely File > Properties spreadsheet software) convert text hyperlinks manually, required

title: Accessibility guidance checklist
text: tables show features {a11ytables} package meet GSS Best Practice Impacts Division’s ‘Making spreadsheets accessible: checklist basics’. assessment based generating unedited output typical {a11ytables} workflow: new_a11ytable() passed create_a11y_wb() written openxlsx::saveWorkbook().

Visit {a11ytables} website documentation. package (opinionated) active development. Please see NEWS file latest changes. Please leave ideas issues raise pull request.

title: Create Spreadsheet Publications Following GSS Best Practice
text: Install package GitHub using {remotes}. {openxlsx} {pillar} also installed. create spreadsheet: Use new_a11ytable() build special dataframe data Use create_a11y_wb() add styles workbook structure Use openxlsx::saveWorkbook() write xlsx file Visit introduction vignette get going, accessbility guidance checklist vignette see package complies guidance. package includes RStudio Addin inserts pre-filled demo skeletons {a11ytables} workflow.

title: Create Spreadsheet Publications Following GSS Best Practice
text: BPID released Python package called ‘gptables’ needs updated. ’s companion R package time writing, {a11ytables} fills gap. package can help fulfil Reproducible Analytical Pipeline automating generation compliant spreadsheets publication.

title: Create An 'a11ytable' Object — new_a11ytable
text: Create new a11ytable-class object, data.frame contains information needed publication. turn, used populate 'openxlsx' Workbook-class object function create_a11y_wb.

title: Create An 'a11ytable' Object — new_a11ytable
code: new_a11ytable(   tab_titles,   sheet_types = c("cover", "contents", "notes", "tables"),   sheet_titles,   sources = NULL,   table_names,   tables )

title: Create An 'a11ytable' Object — new_a11ytable
text: tab_titles Required character vector, one value per sheet created. title appear tab final spreadsheet output. Keep brief. sheet_types Required character vector, one value per sheet created. Sheets contain publication tables ('meta' sheets) type 'contents', 'cover' 'notes'. Sheets contain statistical tables data type 'tables'. sheet_titles Required character vector, one value per sheet created. main title sheet, appear cell A1 (top-left corner) sheet. sources Optional character vector, one value per sheet created. origin data given sheet. Supply NA_character_ empty. table_names Required character vector, one value per table created (.e. one per sheet). short, descriptive, identifying name give 'named range' cells compose table final spreadsheet output. Makes sheet navigation accessible. tables Required list data.frames, one per sheet. See details.

title: Create An 'a11ytable' Object — new_a11ytable
text: a11ytable-class object.

title: Create An 'a11ytable' Object — new_a11ytable
text: Formats data.frames 'tables' argument, depending sheet type. Sheet type 'cover': one row per subsection, columns 'Subsection title' 'Subsection text'. example, section contact details might 'Contact details' subsection title telephone number email address body-text column. Use linebreaks (.e. '\n') put multiple rows body text. break information separate spreadsheet rows belong subsection). Sheet type 'contents': one row per sheet, two columns suggested least ('Tab title' 'Worksheet title'). Sheet type 'notes': one row per note, two columns suggested ('Note number', 'Note text'). Sheet type 'tables': tidy, rectangular data.frame containing data published.

title: Create An 'a11ytable' Object — new_a11ytable
code: if (FALSE) { x <- new_a11ytable(     tab_titles   = mtcars_df$tab_title,     sheet_types  = mtcars_df$sheet_type,     sheet_titles = mtcars_df$sheet_title,     sources      = mtcars_df$source,     table_names  = mtcars_df$table_name, ) is_a11ytable(x) }

title: a11ytables 0.0.0.90015
text: Added improved warnings errors (#34) Simplified -built dataset matches ‘get started’ vignette Updated gif used ‘get started’ vignette

title: a11ytables 0.0.0.90014
text: Added explanations accessibility checklist vignette Converted ‘quickstart’ vignette ‘get started’, used simpler example, added gif Removed ‘construct’ vignette Used ‘reference’ _pkgdown.yaml better separate functions site

title: a11ytables 0.0.0.90013
text: Added RStudio Addin insert code {a11ytables} workflow (#54)

title: a11ytables 0.0.0.90012
text: Made source, notes table insertion dynamic, row insertino dependent others (#33) Applied table styling based dynamic table placement (#33)

title: a11ytables 0.0.0.90011
text: Prevented tab title pasted titles tables sheets (#48) Made sure wrap non-header cells tables sheets (#41) Provided auto-column-width adjustment tables cell content headers long (#41)

title: a11ytables 0.0.0.90010
text: Added warnings issues detected making a11ytables-class object (#34) Added modified-mtcars example dataset, mtcars_df (#20) Expunged lfs_tables (#20) Added ‘Crown Copyright’ authors copyright holder Updated README vignettes given changes Added new quickstart vignette simplified README (#43) Handled plurals periods meta sheet elements, update detection notes column headers

title: a11ytables 0.0.0.9009
text: Converted print method summary method, suggested @TimTaylor (#23) Imported {pillar} {tibble}-style printing, suggested @TimTaylor (#26) Added @TimTaylor contributor Updated vignettes README HOTFIX: corrected .detect_notes() actually works

title: a11ytables 0.0.0.9008
text: Ensured numeric columns (even contain string like ‘[c]’ indicate suppressed value) right-aligned (#32) Isolated .insert_*() functions table count note presence .insert_prelim_a11y(), clarity

title: a11ytables 0.0.0.9007
text: BREAKING CHANGE: removed subtables ’re used now confusing Added first draft vignettes create a11ytable accessibility guidance checklist (#22)

title: a11ytables 0.0.0.9006
text: HOTFIX: fixed problem tab_title used filter sheet_type

title: a11ytables 0.0.0.9005
text: BREAKING CHANGE: user-supplied table cover sheet now supplied tidy two-column data.frame row per subsection, columns ‘subsection title’ ‘subsection body’ Updated lfs_tables lfs_subtables example datasets given ; example see lfs_tables[lfs_tables$sheet_type == "cover", "table"][[1]]

title: a11ytables 0.0.0.9004
text: BREAKING CHANGE: switched using sheet_type column a11ytable-class object infer sheet type ‘cover’, ‘contents’, ‘notes’ ‘tables’ (replacing ‘meta’); ’s longer tab_title serves role (#18). Ensured styles .add_*() now make internal references sheet_type rather tab_title

title: a11ytables 0.0.0.9003
text: BREAKING CHANGE: retired fully add_*() function family building workbook ‘hand’, given introduction create_a11y_wb() Introduced S3 class ‘a11ytable’, including exported functions generate (new_a11ytable(), as_a11ytable()) test (is_a11ytable()) objects class

title: a11ytables 0.0.0.9002
text: Simplified add_*() functions single create_a11y_wb() function (moving towards #15), though add_*() functions still exported Split supplied data two, without sub-table examples: lfs_tables lfs_subtables, respectively Updated README detail simplified approach

title: a11ytables 0.0.0.9001
text: Added un-exported .style_*() utils functions style worksheets (#1) Incorporated style functions add_*table()* functions Updated README Added basic tests, defensive stops (#10, #11) Added GitHub Actions RMD check, coverage {pkgdown} (#7) Transferred ownership matt-dray co-analysis (#9)

title: a11ytables 0.0.0.9000
text: Added NEWS.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, README.Rmd Added exported add_*() functions create different tab types (cover, contents, notes, tables) Added un-exported .insert_*() utils functions insert within-sheet elements Added MIT license LICENSE.md
